definition: lit. quick sword cuts through tangled hemp (idiom); decisive action in a complex situation/cutting the Gordian knot
rapid/quick/speed/rate/soon/almost/to make haste/clever/sharp (of knives or wits)/forthright/plainspoken/gratified/pleased/pleasant
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
surname Dao
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
variant of 麻[ma2]/hemp
generic name for hemp, flax etc/hemp or flax fiber for textile materials/sesame/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/(of materials) rough or coarse/pocked/pitted/to have pins and needles or tingling/to feel numb
surname Ma

sentences.english: He never procrastinates , but always takes resolute measures to solve a complicated problem in an instant.
sentences.chinese: 他干什么事总是快刀斩乱麻，从不拖泥带水。

sentences.english: Often say "cut the Gordian knot" and the knife can continue, but more threads.
sentences.chinese: 常说“快刀斩乱麻”，可这一刀下去，头绪却更多了。

sentences.english: He could cut through disputes with the sharp knife of authority.
sentences.chinese: 他可以运用他的权威象快刀斩乱麻样地解决纠纷。

definition: to make a decision when it's time to decide
better to just get the pain over with, rather than prolong the agony
pinyin: chang2 tong4 bu4 ru2 duan3 tong4

definition: a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
to bring to a conclusion/to settle (a dispute)/to do away with (oneself)/to break off (a relationship)/resolution (of a problem)
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
lit. two segments with a single cut (idiom)/fig. to make a clean break (idiom)
to illuminate/to open up (a topic)
(of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
to get away from/to withdraw/to free oneself
indecisive/irresolute
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
to lay one's cards on the table
to part without hard feelings (idiom)/to cut the knot as smoothly as you tied it
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
